data.title: blacklist pythontex in the buildsystem

milestone.title: Next release
milestone.description: We have a working Qt GUI and many more features! This release is soooo overdue...

data.body:
Pythontex is some kind of a python interpreter bundled with texlive. CMake finds it, but it's not suitable for what we are doing (obviously). We should blacklist it to get rid of clutter in the configure output. Also the "dropping invalid python interpreter" message (for the remaining possible cases) should not be a warning, but a normal message without modifiers.
Configure output 
[...]
Testing /usr/bin/python3
Testing /usr/bin/python3.6
Testing /usr/bin/python2.7
Testing /usr/bin/python3.6m
Testing /usr/share/texmf-dist/scripts/pythontex/pythontex.py
usage: pythontex.py [-h] [--version] [--encoding ENCODING]
                    [--error-exit-code {true,false}] [--runall [{true,false}]
                    | --rerun {never,modified,errors,warnings,always}]
                    [--hashdependencies [{true,false}]] [-j N] [-v]
                    [--interpreter INTERPRETER]
                    [--debug [::] | --interactive
                    [::]]
                    TEXNAME
pythontex.py: error: unrecognized arguments: -c
CMake Warning at buildsystem/modules/FindPython.cmake:149 (message):
  Dropping invalid python interpreter
  '/usr/share/texmf-dist/scripts/pythontex/pythontex.py'
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  buildsystem/HandlePythonOptions.cmake:6 (find_package)
  CMakeLists.txt:69 (include)
[...]

data.title: increase verbosity level of some annoying messages
data.body:
Set verbosity level of spammy messages to `debug` or `spam`.
Also some minor consistency fixes.

data.title: force colored cmake output in kevin builds
data.body: SFTtech/kevin#14. For the time being, this should be an acceptable workaround.

data.title: [WIP] doc on formations
data.body:
I've created [this gist](https://gist.github.com/Piruzzolo/e744c9da5ed18898fae85f29a560e90f) on units formations. As you can see from the revision log, it is still a work in progress. I'm finding a way to express the last formula in terms of integer functions only (i.e. `Mod`, `Ceil`, `Floor` and so on). I will make a PR with a recap of the gist as ready.
This is for you to know and discuss and (possibly, if you feel to), contribute ideas 👍

data.title: purge manual font rendering
data.body:
Right now, we are using fontconfig, freetype and harfbuzz for rendering fonts in some places, while Qt5 is used in the newer GUI code. We should get rid of the low-level libraries.

* [ ] find code that uses our own font renderer (`libopenage/renderer/font`)
* [ ] use Qt5 instead
* [ ] remove the font renderer
* [ ] update buildsystem and docs

data.title: single file conversion for other file types
data.body: Currently, only SLP files are supported. Exporting opus files and other stuff would be nice.

data.title: build cython generated files with reduced warnings

milestone.title: Next release
milestone.description: We have a working Qt GUI and many more features! This release is soooo overdue...

data.body: After upgrading the compiler, there are often lots of warnings about generated code. We need a sane way of silencing this, preferably by setting seperate compiler flags for handwritten and generated code.

data.title: docs: Reverse engineering for Alarms, Pathfinding, Stats & more
data.body:
More docs revealing some of the mysteries of Age of Empires II.

**Where does this information come from?**
From various sources on the internet and/or books and post mortems from developers. I provided links in the files, so everyone should be able to verify the info (and maybe add things that I missed).

**What do these docs cover?**

Alarm sounds:
- Differences in the 4 different "You are being attacked!" alerts and when they are played
- Battle sizes and alarm sounds
- Cooldown for alarms/alerts

Town Bell:
- Range
- Distribution of villagers algorithms

Waypoints:
- How they work
- Limits

Pathfinding:
- Short description of the three pathfinding algorithms and their underlying mechanics

Villagers:
- Build speed + Formula
- Switching tasks and losing resources
- Wolves and villagers (mostly focussed on balancing)

Unit stats:
Snapshot of available units and their stats from AoK, AoC, FE and African Kingdoms

data.title: make pylint errors go away
data.body: Closes #699. Once SFTtech/kevin#13 is done, this can be reworked.

data.title: pylint complains about code from master
data.body:
This leads to kevin failing all sanity checks in the Arch VM.
I'm fixing it right now.

data.title: fix build with libbacktrace, clean up log includes
data.body:
* Fixed linker error when building with libbacktrace.
* `log/log.h` was implicitly imported by `error/error.h`.
* Reordered some includes to match "associated - global - local" structure.

data.title: Create a better sprite format
data.body:
Converting from slp to png seems to lose some of  the original information, which pixels are part of the outline, or which are real colours, or player colours.

For use in opengl or vulkan, we could save multiple layers per converted slp file:
1: Sprite plain colours as RGB
2: Player colours: mono (later replaced in shader, with player colour)
3: Outlines: mono (later replaced in shader, with player colour)

Maybe use a different format (can png save multiple layers in one file?)
or create a new format, probably just some container for png, and save to different files in conversion

Also, some unit can appear too small on hidpi and could use upscaling. Probably do this while loading assets.

data.title: kevin: build with libbacktrace
data.body: @TheJJ please install backtrace in kevin so the related code gets tested.

data.title: show timestamp in build output for easier VM troubleshooting
data.body: #649 had a CI error because of a missing pep8 module. It would have been nice to see a timestamp in the build output.

data.title: Market resource prices
data.body:
This market resource buy and sell logic (not the building)

- The global base prices
- Calc prices for selling and buying
- Perform buy and sell


Based on [doc/reverse_engineering/market.md#prices](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/master/doc/reverse_engineering/market.md#prices).

data.title: Spelling overhaul and rev-eng rates for some stuff
data.body: Fixed a bunch of typos

data.title: Grouping resource collection to save CPU
data.body:
In the original game, when a lot of workers all work at the same resource tile they make frequent collection calls (C) 
`time-------->`
`x---C1--C2---x---C1--C2---x---C1--C2---x`

C1 stands for "call of worker 1", likewise C2, traits are frames, x is the nth frame

When the resource collection is off-screen (i.e. the player doesn't watch), we could "group" resource collection calls from miners, lumberjacks and others in a single one, to save CPU, so that, say every nth frame, the resource tile value is `resource -= (number of workers) * (resource taken by each worker)`. As a worker is full, the resource (and the rate) diminishes by a worker until he comes back to work.

Something like:
`time-------->`
`B{1, 2}----------B{1, 2}----------B{1, 2}---G1------B{2}---R1------B{1, 2}`

- B{1, 2} is "big call {worker 1, worker 2}" (B is at frame nth), 
- G1 is when "worker 1 goes", 
- B{2} is big call with worker 2 only, 
- R1 is when "returns 1"

The resources taken by each worker would be updated syncronously in the same nth frame, with a delay to take into account the time workers actually began working at the tile (so they're not full all at the same time - wouldn't be faithful of the original game)

data.title: Multiple searchpaths for assets and configuration

milestone.title: Next release
milestone.description: We have a working Qt GUI and many more features! This release is soooo overdue...

data.body:
Currently, we only focus on the in-devtree-version. But the `make install`'d version should catch up and also support the appropriate search paths:

Dev-mode detection currently works by the ability to `import devmode`, because `devmode.py` is not installed and thereby the import will fail.

Search paths:
* if in devmode, only(?): `$repo/`
* `~/.local/share/openage/` / `~/.config/openage/`
* `/usr/share/openage/` / `/etc/openage/`

And of course the matching parts on windows/macOS/whatever.
Basically, we will adhere to http://standards.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html

The order depends on the data type to be located:

* config files are loaded global first, then user, ...: values get overidden and specialized then
* assets are searched local first, so that the most-custom-asset wins

This is also a step towards our modding API.
Assets can either be in `.tar.*` archives or extracted folders in the search paths. The mounting of archives is done transparently by #630.


As a first step, I'd suggest you install the game with `make install`, then **leave the repo folder** and try to run it with `python3 -m openage`. You should of course package the game to avoid filesystem clutter.

* [x] searchpaths
* [x] global launcher (something like `/usr/bin/openage`) #709


Fixes #610
Depends on #630
Will help #667
Will be used by #632 later
Fixes #709

data.title: Normalize install prefixes in cmake

milestone.title: Next release
milestone.description: We have a working Qt GUI and many more features! This release is soooo overdue...

data.body:
Please normalize the paths that are shown after the buildsystem configuration step:

observed:
```
   install prefix | /usr/local/../asdf/../test
py install prefix | /usr/lib/python-exec/python3.5/../../../lib64/python3.5/site-packages
```

expected:
```
   install prefix | /usr/test
py install prefix | /usr/lib64/python3.5/site-packages
```

data.title: Efficient storage of unit positions
data.body:
We have to store the unit positions efficiently, so they are rendered and interacted with on demand only.
We might want to use our chunks for that.
Currently, all units are contained in the `class UnitContainer` in the `live_units` map.

The new hierarchy should be bound to our chunks to allow better local search for neighbors.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quadtree

data.title: docs: Reverse engineering for Monks, Accuracy and Ram Speed
data.body:
Made some docs for reverse engineering and added new info to other docs.

**Where does this information come from?**
Mainly from the Youtube Channels of [Spirit of the Law](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChzLZJo-SxuPHz-oYKAIC_g) and [Zero Empires](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoMg6gEYvB9n5RaoIngFFJw). I provided the video links in the files, so that everybody can verify if I got something wrong.

**What do these docs cover?**

Accuracy:
- Relation of accuracy and distance/target size
- How inaccuracy/accuracy is defined by game mechanics
- Damage by stray arrows, scorpions and friendly fire

Damage:
- How and when does the game calculate damage from projectiles?

Market:
- Gold formula for trade carts
- Resource prices and tribute system
- Path finding for trade carts if market is destroyed

Monks:
- Converting buildings

Ram Speed:
- Which units affect the speed of a ram and by how much?

Also included are weird bugs and irritating behaviour that may or may not be kept in OpenAge for nostalgia.

data.title: Update media_convert appmanifest
data.body: Update appmanifest_221380 to not befoul steam's steamapps/common/ directory

data.title: Textfiles code compliance improvements
data.body:
### Code compliance improvements:
- Print line number of an issue
- Added missing space issue (detects `){` and `if/for/while(`)
- Added extra space issue (detects spaces before `;`)
- Can be extended

> For the current master the `make checkfast` print:
>
> ![screenshot from 2017-01-04 17-06-26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6997990/21647642/c5edcfbe-d2a3-11e6-8b9f-9a048d5dbb74.png)

### How it works:
First the whole file string is searched and if at least an issue is found somewhere, the file is searched line by line (in order to generate proper description with  the line and line number).
Regular expressions and generators are used when possible.

data.title: Load data 34 times faster!
data.body:
From
![screenshot from 2017-01-02 15-24-56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6997990/21591957/d6f9f0aa-d111-11e6-9601-7307b88866f7.png)
to
![screenshot from 2017-01-02 16-06-28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6997990/21591962/df66af94-d111-11e6-990e-98592fecc160.png)
(after the first time)

### How
I create a `cache.docx` file which contains all the other `*.docx`. Every time the read csv function is called the the file is added to the cache file. The first time (before the creation of the cache) the load time is like the old days and from the second time and after all the loading is happening from the cache structure much faster (= 34 times faster).

### Notes
- The cache file is only around 13 MB
- Fixed the timers wrong logic
- Comments are not cached

This is basically the patch-only part of #658 which seems to fix the build at least.

data.title: Attributes system improvements
data.body:
### Attributes system improvements goals:

- [x] Abstract shared and ushared attributes
  - [x] share method
  - [x] ~~copy method (???)~~
- [x] Convert `attr_map_t` into a proper class (`Attributes`?)
  - [x] implement
    - [x] add `attributes.cpp` (?)
  - [x] refactor
- [x] Split attributes and refactor changes
  - [x] hitpoints -> hitpoints + current hitpoints (issue #651)
  - [x] building -> building + dropsite (semi-implemented)
  - [x] attack: move attack stance elsewher
- [x] Change the worker atrribute
  - [x] rename
  - [x] split into unshared and shared
    - [x] carrying resources
    - [x] move worker action graphics to somewhere else ($1)
  - [x] gather rate per resource
  - [x] move attack type (used only for villagers) from attack ($2)
- [x] Multitype attribute (for unit with subtypes: villages, trebuchets)
  - [x] implement
  - [x] refactor producers and fix $1 and $2
- [x] Change type bugs
  - [x] use `reinitialise` instead of `reinitialise` in order to keep the unshared attributes (eg. life)
- [x] ~~Actions attribute calls optimize~~
  - [x] ~~move has/get attribute in constructor (call once and store) (?)~~
  - [x] ~~move basic operations inside attributes~~
- [x] Add doc


### Notes

- All files including `attributes.h`: `unit_type.h`, `unit.h`, `action.h`
- `Attributes` methods:
  - bool add/has/removeAttribute (hide all map methods)
  - Attribute get<attr_type>

### Bugs found (and solved) on the way

- Health reset every time villager changes resources (eg. from wood to stone) (wait... no)
- One gather rate for all resources
- Search for new building to build includes enemy's building
- Towers auto attack
- ...

I write a standalone program to see whether SDL2 would work on my computer, and it opened device normally in my standalone program.
I suspect there's something wrong with the `CMakeLists.txt` config in `libopenage`.

I deduced with following demo program:
```
#include "stdio.h"
#include <SDL2/SDL.h>

int main() {
        printf("%d\n", SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_AUDIO));
        printf("%d\n", SDL_GetNumAudioDevices(0));
        return 0;
}
```

When I `g++` with linker flags `/usr/local/lib/libSDL2.so -ldl -lpthread`, it returns
```
0
1
```

But when with linker flags `/usr/local/lib/libSDL2.a -ldl -lpthread`, it returns
```
0
0
```

Is it possible that linking with static one will break down audio system of SDL2?

Thanks!
